Viral, Gubernur Kalimantan Tengah Lempar Botol di Laga Vs Persib
02 Nov 2019, 11:14 by Tempo.co, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Aksi Gubernur Kalimantan Tengah Sugianto Sabran saat menyaksikan laga Kalteng Putra vs Persib Bandung, Jumat, 1 November 2019, menjadi viral di media sosial. Orang nomor satu di Kalteng itu pun menjadi bulan-bulanan kritik netizen.
Aksi negatif Sugianto Sabran, yang terjadi dalam laga yang dimenangi Persib 2-0, terekam video dan kemudian menjadi viral di media sosial. Video itu antara lain diunggah Heni Unique (@heniunique).
Pada video itu, terlihat ulah Gubernur saat berada di tribun VVIP Stadion Tuah Pahoe, Jalan Tjilik Riwut, Palangka Raya. Mengenakan kaus warna oranye dan topi warna hitam, ia terlihat melempar botol air mineral ke arah lapangan.
Dia juga terlihat marah-marah sambil menunjuk-nunjuk sebelum turun dari tribun VVIP ke pinggir lapangan. Ia menghampiri Kapolres Palangka Raya AKBP Timbul Siregar dan memarahinya.
Ulah Sugianto Sabran mendapat respons negatif dari netizen. Heni Unique sendiri menyertai unggahan video itu dengan keterangan "Patrich Wanggai Dikartu Merah, Gubernur Sugianto Lempar Botol dan Turun ke Lapangan, Kalteng Putra - Persib 2-0. Kumaha ieu teh kang @ridwankamil ?"



Kenapa menyinggung Ridwan Kamil? Hal itu sempat ditanya netizen lain. "RK woles kalo hadapi masalah. Gak emosian," jawab Heni.
Pada unggahan video lain yang merupakan rangkaian dari kejadian sama, Heni menambahkan komentar, "Bapak Gubernur Kalteng yang terhormat, tolong beri contoh yang baik untuk para supporter. sepak bola di Indonesia."
Netizen lain banyak yang mengecam ulah Sugianto Sabran. "CC. @kemendagri mohon ada tindakan administratif pak.. memberikan contoh buruk pada warganya..," cuit @Bams_1eng. "Weleeeh pemimpin kok gak bs kasih contoh yg baik, emosi boleh pak, tp bukan gtu jg kali...," kata @AhlisWae.
Dalam pertandingan itu, Kalteng Putra harus bermain dengan 10 orang sejak menit ke-30 karena Patrich Wanggai mendapat kartu merah. Persib kemudian mendapat gol dari Van Kippersluis dan Ezechiel Ndouassel.
Kalteng putra masih terpuruk di zona degradasi, sedangkan Persib menempati urutan kedelapan klasemen Liga 1.

Viral, Governor of Central Kalimantan Throwing a Bottle at Match Vs Persib
02 Nov 2019, 11:14 by Tempo.co, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The action of Central Kalimantan Governor Sugianto Sabran while watching the Kalteng Putra vs Persib Bandung match, Friday, November 1, 2019, became viral on social media. The number one person in Central Kalimantan became a hotbed of criticism from netizens.
Sugianto Sabran's negative action, which took place in the match won by Persib 2-0, was recorded on video and then went viral on social media. The video was uploaded, among others, by Heni Unique (@heniunique).
In the video, the governor's actions were seen while in the VVIP stands of Tuah Pahoe Stadium, Jalan Tjilik Riwut, Palangka Raya. Wearing an orange shirt and black hat, he was seen throwing bottles of mineral water toward the field.
He also looked angry while pointing before descending from the VVIP stands to the sidelines. He approached the Police Chief of Palangkaraya AKBP Timbul Siregar and scolded him.
Ulah Sugianto Sabran received a negative response from netizens. Heni Unique himself accompanied the video upload with the statement "Patrich Wanggai Dikartu Merah, Governor Sugianto Throw Bottles and Go to the Field, Kalteng Putra - Persib 2-0. Kumaha ieu teh kang @ridwankamil?"



Why offend Ridwan Kamil? It was asked by other netizens. "RK woles if faced with a problem. Not emotional," said Heni.
In another video upload which is a series of similar events, Heni added the comment, "Dear Governor of Central Kalimantan, please give a good example for supporters. Football in Indonesia."
Many other netizens criticized Sugianto Sabran's actions. "CC. @Kemendagri, please take administrative action, sir ... give bad examples to its citizens ...," tweet @ Bams_1eng. "How come the leader can't give a good example, emotions may be sir, but that's not the time ...," @AhlisWae said.
In that match, Kalteng Putra had to play with 10 people since the 30th minute because Patrich Wanggai got a red card. Persib then got goals from Van Kippersluis and Ezechiel Ndouassel.
Central Kalimantan men are still slumped in the relegation zone, while Persib ranks eighth in the League 1 standings.
